mapper.select: select MENU_ID, NAME, PARENT_ID, URL, PERMS, TYPE, ORDER_NUM, SYSTEM_TYPE, CREATE_TIME, CREATE_USER, UPDATE_TIME, UPDATE_USER from TB_SYS_MENU where MENU_ID = #{menuId}
select MENU_ID, NAME, PARENT_ID, URL, PERMS, TYPE, ORDER_NUM, SYSTEM_TYPE, CREATE_TIME, CREATE_USER, UPDATE_TIME, UPDATE_USER from TB_SYS_MENU where NAME = #{menuName}
select count(*) from TB_SYS_MENU where NAME = #{menuName}

select case role_id when to_number(#{roleId}) then 'true' else 'false' end as "checked",m.system_type as "systemType", m.menu_id as "menuId",name as "name",parent_id as "parentId",perms as "perms",type as "type",order_num as "orderNum" from tb_sys_menu m left join tb_sys_role_menu rm on m.menu_id=rm.menu_id and rm.role_id=#{roleId} order by m.order_num

select T1.MENU_ID, T1.NAME, T1.PARENT_ID, T1.URL, T1.PERMS, T1.TYPE, T1.ORDER_NUM, T1.SYSTEM_TYPE, T1.CREATE_TIME, T1.CREATE_USER, T1.UPDATE_TIME, T1.UPDATE_USER from tb_sys_menu t1 inner join tb_sys_role_menu t2 on T1.MENU_ID = T2.MENU_ID inner join tb_sys_user_role t3 on t2.role_id = t3.role_id inner join tb_sys_user t4 on t3.user_id = t4.user_id
t4.status='1' and t4.user_id = #{userId}
